meanings.definition: To protect or secure against attack or harm.
meanings.sent1: The brave knight defenced the castle from invaders.
meanings.sent2: The soldiers defenced the city walls during the battle.
meanings.sent3: The clever squirrel defenced its acorn stash from other animals.
meanings.sent4: The mother bird defenced her nest with fierce determination.
meanings.sent5: The security guard defenced the museum artifacts with utmost care.

meanings.definition: A barrier, railing, or other structure used to protect or enclose a place.
meanings.sent1: The wooden defenced around the garden kept the rabbits out.
meanings.sent2: The metal defenced along the highway ensured safety for drivers.
meanings.sent3: The colorful defenced in the playground made the children happy.
meanings.sent4: The ancient stone defenced of the castle added to its grandeur.
meanings.sent5: The electric defenced around the zoo protected the animals from harm.

meanings.definition: The act of defending or protecting.
meanings.sent1: The defenced of the village was a joint effort by all residents.
meanings.sent2: The defenced of the endangered species required global cooperation.
meanings.sent3: The defenced of the championship title was intense but fair.
meanings.sent4: The defenced of human rights is a noble cause that requires dedication.
meanings.sent5: The defenced of the ancient ruins was crucial for preserving history.
